aoop.asteroids.udp

Class Client

    • aoop.asteroids.udp.Base

extends Base
implements java.util.Observer

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int UDPPort
      The port that the Client will try to create a Socket on, by default.

      • Fields inherited from class aoop.asteroids.udp.Base

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client(java.lang.String host, int port, boolean isSpectator, java.lang.String playerName)
      This constructor creates a new ClientSender with the specified host and port, as well as starting a ClientReceiver thread that listens for packets on the same socket.
      After this, a ClientGame is started; this is the graphical representation of the game on the client-side.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkIfLatestPacket(org.json.simple.JSONObject packetData) 
      void confirmConnectionExistance()
      If there is a connection, set hasConnected to true.
      SpaceshipController getController() 
      ClientGame getGame() 
      boolean hasConnected() 
      boolean hasLost() 
      boolean isConnected() 
      void stopClient()
      Tells all threads that have been started by this object to stop running.
      void update(java.util.Observable arg0, java.lang.Object arg1)
      Runs every time the ClientGame's state has changed.
      -> Sends a PlayerJoin or SpectatorJoin packet until the Client is connected.
      -> If no longer connected, freezes the game if the time since the last connection was longer than the timeout.
      -> Otherwise, send an update (Either a PlayerUpdate packet or SpectatorPing packet, depending on isSpectator
      void updateConnectionData(org.json.simple.JSONObject packetData)
      Will save the last packet ID to be the ID of the passed packetData, and the last Ping Time to be now.

    • Field Detail

      • UDPPort

        public static int UDPPort
        The port that the Client will try to create a Socket on, by default. If this port is taken, (For instance by another running copy of this application), consecutive ports after this one are tried.
        See Also:
        createSocketOnFirstUnusedPort()

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String host,
      int port,
      boolean isSpectator,
      java.lang.String playerName)
        This constructor creates a new ClientSender with the specified host and port, as well as starting a ClientReceiver thread that listens for packets on the same socket.
        After this, a ClientGame is started; this is the graphical representation of the game on the client-side.
        Parameters:
        host - the host address to connect to
        port - the port to connect to on the host address
        isSpectator - if true, the Client will run in Spectator mode. Otherwise, runs in Player mode.
        playerName - the name that the player wants to use in the game. (only used if isSpectator is false)

    • Method Detail

      • hasConnected

        public boolean hasConnected()
        Returns:
        True if there has been a connection with the server at some point after creation of this instance.

      • confirmConnectionExistance

        public void confirmConnectionExistance()
        If there is a connection, set hasConnected to true.

      • stopClient

        public void stopClient()
        Tells all threads that have been started by this object to stop running.
        See Also:
        ClientGame.abort(), BaseReciever.stopReciever()

      • checkIfLatestPacket

        public boolean checkIfLatestPacket(org.json.simple.JSONObject packetData)
        Returns:
        True if the given packet's ID (stored in the 'r' JSON field) is higher than the one stored previously.

      • updateConnectionData

        public void updateConnectionData(org.json.simple.JSONObject packetData)
        Will save the last packet ID to be the ID of the passed packetData, and the last Ping Time to be now.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        true if it has been less long than Base.MaxNonRespondTime since the last time a packet was received.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable arg0,
          java.lang.Object arg1)
        Runs every time the ClientGame's state has changed.
        -> Sends a PlayerJoin or SpectatorJoin packet until the Client is connected.
        -> If no longer connected, freezes the game if the time since the last connection was longer than the timeout.
        -> Otherwise, send an update (Either a PlayerUpdate packet or SpectatorPing packet, depending on isSpectator
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer

      • getController

        public SpaceshipController getController()
        Returns:
        a reference to the SpaceshipController object.

      • hasLost

        public boolean hasLost()
        Returns:
        true if the spaceship with this player's name has been destroyed.

      • getGame

        public ClientGame getGame()
        Returns:
        a reference to the ClientGame object.
